it.uniroma3.mat.extendedset.util
Class CollectionMap<K,I,C extends java.util.Collection<I>>

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      java.util.HashMap<K,V>
          java.util.LinkedHashMap<K,C>
              it.uniroma3.mat.extendedset.util.CollectionMap<K,I,C>
Type Parameters:
K - key type
I - item type
C - Collection subclass used to collect items
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<K,C>
public class CollectionMap<K,I,C extends java.util.Collection<I>>
extends java.util.LinkedHashMap<K,C>

This class implements a Map from a key of type K to a collection contains instances of I.

Version:
$Id$
Author:
Alessandro Colantonio
See Also:

newCollectionMap

public static <KX,IX,CX extends java.util.Collection<IX>,EX extends CX> CollectionMap<KX,IX,CX> newCollectionMap(EX emptySet)
Generates a new CollectionMap instance. It is an alternative to the constructor CollectionMap(Collection) that reduces the code to write.

Type Parameters:
KX - key type
IX - item type
CX - Collection subclass used to collect items
EX - empty subset type
Parameters:
emptySet - the empty collection
Returns:
the new instance of CollectionMap

mapValueToKeys

public void mapValueToKeys(java.util.Map<I,K> map)
Populates the current instance with the data from another map. In particular, it creates the list of keys associated to each value.

Parameters:
map - the input map
